column13: the old universe was thrown into the ash-heap and a new one created. He and his eighteenth-century
column14: troglodytic Boston were suddenly cut apart -- separated forever -- in act if not in sentiment
column15: by the opening of the Boston and Albany Railroad; the appearance of the first Cunard steamers in the bay; and the telegraphic messages which carried from Baltimore to Washington the news that Henry Clay and James K. Polk were nominated for the Presidency. This was in May
column16: 1844; he was six years old ; his new world was ready for use
column17: and only fragments of the old met his eyes.
